caption.title: Comparison of simulated and estimated dispersal kernels.
caption.p: From left to right: kernels with the minimum, lower quartile, median, upper quartile and maximum Kullback-Leibler (KL) distances (posterior mean), as estimated (red) under the most exhaustive scheme (Î˜ 4), based on simulated epidemics with short-, medium- and long-range kernels (from top to bottom; black). Kernels are represented by their marginal cumulative distribution function F 1 D (with distance from the source represented on the log 10 scale). The mean KL distance is indicated for each estimation.
